key_title: Key to the species of Callitriche

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Callitrichaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Callitrichaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Fruit not or scarcely broader than long
Leaves rhombic to orbicular, sometimes with a single obscure tooth on each side; fruit with wing c. one-third the width of the mericarp
Leaves spathulate, obovate or elliptic, margins never toothed; fruit not winged or with wing much less than one-quarter the width of the mericarp
Most fruits pedicellate, pedicels 0.5–4 mm long
All fruits more or less sessile, pedicels 0–0.5 mm long
Leaves obovate; styles longer than ripe fruit; fruit not umbonate at base
Leaves linear-obovate; styles shorter than ripe fruit; fruit umbonate at base
Lower, earlier leaves 3-nerved, linear-spathulate to spathulate; mature fruit pale
Lower, earlier leaves 1-nerved, linear; mature fruit brown or black
Fruit much thicker at base than above
Fruit not or scarcely thicker at base than above
Styles deflexed; bracteoles absent or inconspicuous; at least some lower fruit usually on long peduncles, almost circular
Styles erect or slightly spreading; bracteoles conspicuous; all fruit subsessile, longer than wide
